existing_analysis_references.relationship: Historical RKLB fundamental analysis for comparative context
Space/Aerospace sector context including RKLB peer analysis

business_model.core_description: Vertically integrated end-to-end space company providing launch services, spacecraft manufacturing, and space systems solutions
revenue_streams: Space Systems Division (71% of revenue) - satellite manufacturing, components, star trackers, reaction wheels, solar arrays
Launch Services Division (29% of revenue) - Electron small satellite launches, upcoming Neutron medium-lift rocket
Defense contracts and national security launches
competitive_advantages: Proven launch success rate (100% for Electron across 63+ launches)
Significant contracted backlog providing revenue visibility
Emerging Neutron rocket for medium-lift market expansion
key_performance_indicators: Defense positioning: $515M USSF contract (largest to date)
Market expansion: Neutron development for 8-ton payload class

cash_flow_analysis.cash_position_strength: Strong with $419M liquid assets providing 2+ years runway

historical_trends.investment_intensity: High R&D spending at 40% of revenue driving innovation

management_quality.leadership_assessment: Experienced space industry leader with strong execution track record

governance_metrics.strategic_vision: Clear roadmap for Neutron development and market expansion

High-growth profile with 40% of revenue invested in R&D for future capabilities
Successful transition to integrated space systems company beyond pure launch services

Unique vertical integration spanning launch services to satellite manufacturing
Strong defense positioning with largest USSF contract ($515M) in company history
Neutron development positions for medium-lift market expansion against SpaceX

Economic environment with decreasing rates favorable for growth equity valuations
